name: 'Memorial Day' Quiz / Test | 'West Wing' - Season 5 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who did President Bartlet think Stan Musial was?
questions.explanation:
Pediatrician from Abbey's medical school.

	As Charlie and Toby were helping the president practice throwing pitches in the residence, he said that one day there was going to be somebody in the White House that would tell the story of how President Bartlet thought Stan Musial was a pediatrician from Abbey's medical school.

questions.text: After the restaurant meeting in Germany, what flowers did Josh bring Donna?
questions.explanation:
Roses.

	Colin had brought Donna some flowers earlier so Josh picked her up some roses on his way back from the restaurant.

questions.text: What diplomatic ranking does Josh have as Deputy Chief of Staff?
questions.explanation:
Three star general.

	When the doctor wouldn't give Josh any information on Donna's whereabouts, Josh told the nurse that he had the ranking of a three star general and she should tell him where Donna was.

questions.text: Who told Kate Harper that Josh had never been stealthy?
questions.explanation:
Josh.

	After receiving a message in a basket of flowers, Kate talked to Josh about going to a secret meeting. Josh told her over the phone that he had never been stealthy and Donna reiterated from her hospital bed that he was very clumsy.

questions.text: President Bartlet said that the U.S. is what country's best ally?
questions.explanation:
Israel.

	President Bartlet said this after he was told that the Israeli Ambassador was not at the White House yet. The president wanted to information on the apartment building that was bombed in Gaza.

questions.text: During a flashback to when President Bartlet was president-elect, who did he tell Leo was going to be fired after he became president?
questions.explanation:
Fitzwallace.

	Fitzwallace was giving a lot of war information to President-elect Bartlet through General Adamley and causing the soon-to-be president a lot of stress so President-elect Bartlet told Leo to remind him to fire Fitzwallace when they got into office. Of course, that never happened.

questions.text: How far did Toby tell Josh that President Bartlet would have to throw the ball from the stands?
questions.explanation:
Six feet.

	Toby was speaking to Josh, who was still in Germany, about what they should do about the Memorial Day ball toss in Camden Yard. Josh said they should cancel it and then took it back when he realized it wouldn't look good. He did remind Toby to get the president to practice throwing the ball.

questions.text: While on the phone with CJ, from what musical did he say Donna was singing songs?
questions.explanation:
My Fair Lady.

	Donna didn't want to talk to anyone so Josh had to come up with a reason for CJ not to talk to Donna so he was telling her that Donna was still out of it. While they were on the phone, Josh said that Donna was now in intermission.

questions.text: While in the elevator headed to the residence, who did Charlie say was the first president to pitch a ball at a game?
questions.explanation:
William Howard Taft.

	Toby was guessing McKinley and Harrison. McKinley did throw a pitch, but it was as Governor McKinley, Roosevelt threw from the stands and hit a photographer in the head. It was actually Taft who was the first president to throw out a pitch. From behind them, the president remarked, "I hope they made fatty practice".

questions.text: When Josh returned to the hospital from his restaurant meeting, where did he learn Donna was?
options: Watching TV in the waiting room
questions.explanation:
In the operating room.

	Josh returned to Donna's hospital room to find her bed empty and several bloody rags on the floor. When he finally found her, she was in an operating room with Doctor Leahy. The doctor told him that she had a pulmonary embolism and they were getting ready to do surgery. FYI, a pulmonary embolism is what caused Noah Lyman's death.
